(5) where t is the time of the day, t max is the time of the immune system maximum (both rescaled to the unit interval), β 0 is the average transmission rate over the day, C ∈ [0, 1] is the a factor controlling the strength of the circadian effects ( C = 0 meaning no effect, C = 1 meaning the at the maximum of the immune system the transmission rate is zero (so the person is perfectly immune to the disease). See the illustration in Fig 2. We include the parameter Δ t to model the effect of hypothetically shifting the travel patterns (for example by changing office hours or the time zone). If Δ t = 1 hour then the travel patterns would be delayed one hour compared to the observed patterns.
